name: **Inishlyon  – _Inis Laighean_**
description: Inishlyon – Inis Laighean L560-647 Sheet 37 The name means ‘Strip of Land’. A small island, just SE of and separated from Inishbofin at HW. The best landing is onto the beach at the western end of the N side (facing the beautiful E beach of Inishbofin). There is an automatic, small, white lighthouse at Lyon Head on the eastern end, where there is a fierce tidal race on the ebb.
